column2: Reflect on Mahashivaratri
As the night descends across your realm you feel compelled to attend to "The Great Night of Shiva", a vigil of solemn reflection and dance in honor of the Lord Shiva.
Celebrating Mahashivaratri
This character is partaking in the solemn night of Mahashivaratri
The Last Vow

You have finally decided to take a final vow.  As Lord Shiva deserves your full devotion, it is now time for you to progressively abandon any food or beverage and fast till death comes at you. Hereby, you shall slander your passions, subjugate them and let your body achieve inner peace.
Praise Shiva!
I am not ready for this.
You have fasted for a few days now, only allowing yourself milk and whey. Your vow is only beginning, and it is time for you to bury yourself even deeper into meditation.
I await for my liberation.
Your fast is now has now lasted a few weeks, and you have switched from milk and whey to spiced water. While you have started feeling dizzy for few hours now, you feel extraordinally relieved.
Purging my passions is the only way of accessing to Nirvana.
You now have abandoned spiced water, the final phase of your fasting is beginning. You're starting to feel rather weak, but your mind is sharper than ever.
My mind and body is ready.
Your fasting is coming to an end. You can feel it. Strength has abandoned your body, only death awaits you now.
Nirvana is close!

Your fasting is coming to end. You can feel it. Strength has abandoned your body, only death awaits you now. However, while your eyes are starting to close themselves, you witness a vague shape of light speaking to you : "It is soon over, you haven taken your vow honourably.".
Shiva, is this you..?
You cannot feel your body anymore, as if you were levitating. Substance has left your body. You haven taken your vow.
Nirvana awaits me!
As Night Falls...

You and an entourage of your fellow faithful thronged across the lantern lit streets, a light mumuring as folks stand before the temple grounds, having trekked roughly 14-kilometers barefoot to the temple. The pujari welcomes the crowd with a word words of comfort. You glance at the imposing dvarapala guarding the temple door emblazened by the image of Kankalamurti, an image of Bhairava, an aspect of Lord Shiva, as you make your way inside. The temple grounds are brightly lit with cauldrons bellowing before the dusk sun fades from view as the plaza is filled with devoutees from across your realm. A Kathavachak presents himself to the crowd clearing his throat preparing to recite the ancient mantras and stories of Lord Shiva Overcoming Darkness and Ignorance.
Praise Lord Shiva!
Let the Festivities Start!
Meditations of Lord Shiva

Many stories are told regarding the nature of the night for which you have all gathered to praise Lord Shiva. The Kathavachak tells how Lord Shiva in his anger and grief on this day dance the holy dance of creation, preservation and destruction to overcome the darkness and ignorance of the previous order. Through this divine act he quelled his great anger and grief and this is in part why we devote ourselves to live in Lord Shiva's Auspicious Grace.\nOn the conclusion of the story, the crowd begins a chant which resonates across the temple grounds. You join in this great act of devotion...
Om Namah Shivaya!
The Light-Filled Streets

As the crowds begin to make their way out the temple washing themselves before a linga which is said to wash away the sins so that one could walk a more virtuous life. You follow the crowd who began to populate the streets with an array of festive celebrations in honor of Lord Shiva. As you reach the last fork of the road the sounds of soft music accompany by dance beckons from a local market center, you contemplate whether you shall retire to meditation or enjoy a night out in the city...
Perhaps a night out is what I need...
Perhaps I should meditate on this auspicious night...
A Devotional Dance

You enter the market where an array of merchants and performers have set up a fair where many of the cities inhabitants can be seen partaking in the festive mood. You are caught by a group of dancers who are attempting to uphold the many mudras of the Natyasastra in an act of worship through composition of dance. As the music fills the air you can't help but join in the dancing. You become exhausted as you make your way back to the palace contemplating on the events of tonight.
I shall meditate on Lord Shiva's Grace
A Silent Meditation

You prepare a mat in your room as you contemplate Lord Shiva's grace and your devotion to to him. You think about how Lord Shiva is the essence of Creation, the Protector of Life, and also its eventual destroyer. You think of how Lord Shiva overcame Darkness and Ignorance by performing the cosmic dance bringing harmony to the discourse which wraught the world. You contemplate how you can set your self in the virtuous path by following their example...
I shall become the Peserver of Life...
I shall devote myself to a pious life...
I shall become the Bearer of Knowledge...
A Great Night

Time has come to return to the functions as ruler of the realm having spent many days contemplating on your life and devotion in service of Lord Shiva. You hope that through your efforts you have gained a new introspection in what you must do in your life. Whether you will be a better more virtuous leader will be known when you stand before Lord Shiva to contemplate on the life you have lived.
A night worth remembering...

Took Sallekhana vow
As a Mantramarga faithful, it is my duty to choose which path of devotion to Shiva I shall follow.
Lingayatism, as I shall entirely devote myself to Shiva through daily meditating
The path of Natha, focusing my practice on Hatha Yoga and tantrism.
Shaiva Siddhanta, aiming for enlightenment through Shiva's perfection.
Court Siddhar

The Siddhar is a master of Siddha Medicine, responsible for the well-being of your court in many dimensions, both physical and spiritual. The Court Siddhar will attempt to diagnose and cure any ailments which affect your court. Court siddhars are typically learned individuals with education in medicinal and mystical arts.
Recruit Court Siddhar

Send out messengers in order to find a candidate for the position of §YCourt Siddhar§!. You will likely have to pay the candidate in order to entice them to your court. If you already have a §YCourt Siddhar§! and choose to employ a new one, the old one will be resigned from his or her post.
Ensure the entire realm knows you are looking for a candidate for the position of Court Siddhar.\n

You have sent messengers throughout the lands of the[root.religion.GetName] faithful, searching every village and temple for a wise and experiecned Siddhar for your court. One who can balance the three humors: Vaadham, Pittham and Kapam
I hope I do not have to wait long.
I have changed my mind, I do not require [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] services.

Your scouts inform you of a most skilled Siddhar residing in a nearby village. Even though [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] lacks any formal schooling, the villagers swear that [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] has been able to cure any ailment afflicting them. This '[recruited_physician_target.GetFullName]' could easily be persuaded to come take up residence in your court.
I'm willing to take the risk.
